Title:
Epitypification, phylogeny and pathogenicity of
Colletotrichum falcatum, the causative agent of red-rot disease in
sugarcane
Keywords:
disease, plant pathogen, Saccharum officinarum,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Colletotrichum falcatum is an important pathogen of
sugarcane causing red rot disease. The type specimen of this species
could not be located in any herbaria. Fresh specimens were therefore
collected from the location as stated in the protologue. Epitypes of C.
falcatum with a living culture are designated in order to stabilize the
application of the species name. The morphology of conidia and
appressoria, cultural characters and growth rate for the epitype is
provided and its pathogenicity on some hosts is tested. Multi-gene
sequences were generated and deposited in NCBI. Phylogenetic analysis
showed that C. falcatum cluster in a distinct lineage in the
curved-spored Colletotrichum species.
